guicomponents
Class GWindow

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  guicomponents.GWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
GConstants, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class GWindow
extends java.awt.Frame
implements GConstants

Objects of this class are separate windows which can be used to hold G4P GUI components or used for drawing or both combined.

A number of examples are included in the library and can be found at www.lagers.org.uk

Author:
Peter Lager
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

GWindow

public GWindow(PApplet theApplet,
               java.lang.String name,
               int x,
               int y,
               int w,
               int h,
               boolean noFrame,
               java.lang.String mode)
Create a window that can be used to hold G4P components or used for drawing or both together.

Parameters:
theApplet -
name -
x - initial position on the screen
y - initial position on the screen
w - width of the drawing area (the frame will be bigger to accommodate border)
h - height of the drawing area (the frame will be bigger to accommodate border and title bar)
noFrame - if true then the frame has no border
mode - JAVA2D / P2D / P3D / OPENGL

GWindow

public GWindow(PApplet theApplet,
               java.lang.String name,
               int x,
               int y,
               PImage image,
               boolean noFrame,
               java.lang.String mode)
Parameters:
theApplet -
name -
x - initial position on the screen
y - initial position on the screen
image - background image (used to size window)
noFrame - if true then the frame has no border
mode - JAVA2D / P2D / P3D / OPENGL
Method Detail

add

public void add(GComponent component)
Add a G4P component onto the window.

Parameters:
component -

addData

public void addData(GWinData data)
Add an object that holds the data this window needs to use. Note: the object can be of any class that extends GWinData.

Parameters:
data -

setOnTop

public void setOnTop(boolean onTop)
Always make this window appear on top of other windows (or not).
This will not work when run from a remote server (ie Applet over the web) for security reasons. In this situation a call to this method is ignored and a warning is generated.

Parameters:
onTop -

setResizable

public void setResizable(boolean resizable)
Determines whether the window is resizabale or not.
This cannot be set to true if a background image is used.

Overrides:
setResizable in class java.awt.Frame

setBackground

public void setBackground(PImage image)
Set the background image to be used instead of a plain color background
The window will resize to accommodate the image.

Overrides:
setBackground in class java.awt.Component
Parameters:
image -

setAutoClear

public void setAutoClear(boolean auto_clear)
By default the background() method is called to set the background image/colour every frame. You can switch this off by calling this method with a parametr value = false.

Parameters:
auto_clear - whether to call the background method() or not

setActionOnClose

public void setActionOnClose(int action)
This sets what happens when the users attempts to close the window.
There are 3 possible actions depending on the value passed.
GWindow.KEEP_OPEN - ignore attempt to close window (default action) GWindow.CLOSE_WINDOW - close this window, if it is the main window it causes the app to exit
GWindow.EXIT_APP - exit the app, this will cause all windows to close.

Parameters:
action -

getActionOnClose

public int getActionOnClose()
Get the action to be performed when the user attempts to close the window.

Returns:
actionOnClose

close

public void close()
Allows the program to close this window and release its resources.

addDrawHandler

public void addDrawHandler(java.lang.Object obj,
                           java.lang.String methodName)
Attempt to add the 'draw' handler method. The default event handler is a method that returns void and has two parameters Papplet and GWinData

Parameters:
obj - the object to handle the event
methodName - the method to execute in the object handler class

addPreHandler

                          java.lang.String methodName)
Attempt to add the 'pre' handler method. The default event handler is a method that returns void and has two parameters Papplet and GWinData

Parameters:
obj - the object to handle the event
methodName - the method to execute in the object handler class

                            java.lang.String methodName)

Parameters:
obj - the object to handle the event
methodName - the method to execute in the object handler class
